result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed by Judge Melvin on 10-18-2022
Review hearing on January 23, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Case called at 1:37 p.m.
Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angela Wang in court for Scott R Jesion.  
Defendant Scott R Jesion in court, in custody. 
Case is proceeding to a contested competency hearing.
State calls Dr. Brandon Reintjes sworn and testified by video.
Direct-examination by the State.  Cross-examination by the Defense.
Re-direct by the State.  Re-cross by the Defense.
Testimony is closed.
State presents closing arguments.
Defense presents closing arguments.
Court find that the defendant is in need of treatment.
Court orders that the defendant is committed  pursuant to Section 971.14(5), Wis. Statutes. to an inpatient facility.
Defendant's credit time is 9-days per Attorney Wang.
Court sets a Review Hearing in approximately 90-days.
Review hearing scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Detainer placed at: Winnebago Mental Health Institution with fax confirmation

Case called at 10:41 a.m.
Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angela Wang appeared by video for Scott R Jesion.  
Defendant Scott R Jesion appeared by video, in custody at Winnebago Mental Health Institute. 
State makes statements regarding the defendant's failure to appear and requests Cash Bail.
Court sets Signature Bond in the amount of $1,500.00
Court addresses the Competency Report filed by Dr. Reintjes.
Report indicates that the defendant is not competent but likely to become competent.
Defense contests the findings.
Court sets the case for a contested hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Angela Wang
Warrant signed by Judge Melvin III cancelled on 9-6-22
Signed Competency Order
Proposed Competency Order
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

4:16 PM Defendant Scott R Jesion in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Scott R Jesion. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days. The Court will set this matter before to the Trial Court for a review on competency.
Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
